Description: Fragment of a furnishing textile in undyed linen plain weave, with loops (c.3.5cm long/1 every 8 picks); in the centre, c.2 cm from the loops, is a decorative roundel in tapestry, it has 5 medallions, the central one has a rabbit in purple wool on a beige background, the other 4 are decorated with flowers and vegetal motifs; between each flower medallion are stylised yellow and purple baskets, from which two green and one red leaves spring out; the central part is surrounded by two freizes, the first is a guilloche design in undyed wool flying threads on a purple background, the second is of vine leaves in purple on a beige background; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/16), weft-undyed linen (S/10); tapestry on grouped threads; warp-undyed linen (S/5), weft-undyed linen (S/40), yellow, pink, red, light and dark green, purple wool (S/36); flying threads: undyed and purple wool (S); all edges cut and ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
